name.ch: 土壤與地下水汙染整治

department.ch: 環境工程研究所碩士班

goal.en: Guiding students to make use of bioremediation techniques to remove pollutants from soil, groundwater, and estuarine sediment. Meanwhile, this course aims to foster student’s skills in English analytical writing.
goal.ch: 讓學生了解如何利用微生物整治之技術修復受汙染之土壤、地下水、及河口底泥

content.en: This course would be given in a seminar-like style. The former-half semester will be focused on introducing the knowledge such as physical chemical properties of the common pollutants in soil/groundwater/sediment as well as selected studies on chloroethene remediation in soil/groundwater and on remediation of plasticizer esters and estrogens in estuarine sediment. In the latter-half semester, students will be assigned to present representative publications from Environmental Science ＆ Technology and Water Research.
content.ch: 本課程將以半研討會的方式進行。前半學期將教授土壤、地下水及底泥之汙染物質之物化特性及相關知識，並導讀去清除土壤/地下水之氯乙烯以及河口沉積物中增塑劑酯和雌激素之研究。後半學期，本課程將由Environmental Science ＆ Technology 雜誌以及Water Research雜誌中選出具有代表性的相關代表性文章供學生研讀。根據參加此課程的學生人數進行分組口頭報告。

textbook.en: Textbook/References(in English) Journal: Environmental Science ＆ Technology (ACS); Water Research (AWS) (both are the iconic journals in environmental bioremediation).
textbook.ch: 期刊: Environmental Science ＆ Technology (ACS); Water Research (AWS) (此兩期刊皆為國際之環境生物處裡之代表期刊).

method.ch: 講授 研討 實習/實驗

domain.en: 永續環境保護 、 永續環境技術 、 水汙染 、 土壤汙染 、 廢棄物
domain.ch: 永續環境保護 、 永續環境技術 、 水汙染 、 土壤汙染 、 廢棄物

en.competency: The ability to justify principles of judgment and choice with considering the relation between social welfare and environmental sustainability
The ability to define and analyze environmental issues, to strategically plan and propose potential solutions
The ability to implement scientific knowledge and engineering techniques in the face of environmental problems
The ability to assess prospective needs at the macro level, to formulate decision-making, and to direct R & D.
The ability to lead positive and effective communication, coordination, cooperation and integration.
en.Assessments: Presentation/Oral Exam ， Attendance/Performance ， Self Assessment/ Peer Assessment

en.competency: The ability to persistently innovate intelligent humanities, science and engineering.
